    WriteVTK.InputDataType — Constant.

    Types allowed as input to vtk_point_data() and vtk_cell_data().

    Either (abstract) arrays or tuples of arrays are allowed. In the second case, the length of the tuple determines the number of components of the input data (e.g. if N = 3, it corresponds to a 3D vector field).

    WriteVTK.MeshCell

    WriteVTK.VTKDataType — Constant.

    Union of data types allowed by VTK (see file-formats.pdf, page 15).

    WriteVTK.data_to_xml — Function.

    Add numerical data to VTK XML file.

    Data is written under the xParent XML node.

    Nc corresponds to the number of components of the data.

    WriteVTK.data_to_xml_appended — Function.

    Add appended raw binary data to VTK XML file.

    Data is written to the vtk.buf buffer.

    When compression is enabled:

    • the data array is written in compressed form (obviously);

    • the header, written before the actual numerical data, is an array of UInt32 values: [num_blocks, blocksize, last_blocksize, compressed_blocksizes] All the sizes are in bytes. The header itself is not compressed, only the data is. For more details, see: http://public.kitware.com/pipermail/paraview/2005-April/001391.html http://mathema.tician.de/what-they-dont-tell-you-about-vtk-xml-binary-formats (This is not really documented in the VTK specification...)

    Otherwise, if compression is disabled, the header is just a single UInt32 value containing the size of the data array in bytes.

    WriteVTK.data_to_xml_inline — Function.

    Add inline, base64-encoded data to VTK XML file.

    WriteVTK.datatype_str — Function.

    Return the VTK string representation of a numerical data type.

    WriteVTK.eval
    WriteVTK.extent_attribute — Function.

    Return the "extent" attribute required for structured (including rectilinear) grids.

    WriteVTK.include
    WriteVTK.multiblock_add_block
    WriteVTK.num_cells_structured — Function.

    Number of cells in structured grids.

    In 3D, all cells are hexahedrons (i.e. VTKHEXAHEDRON), and the number of cells is (Ni-1)(Nj-1)(Nk-1). In 2D, they are quadrilaterals (VTKQUAD), and in 1D they are line segments (VTK_LINE).

    WriteVTK.num_components — Function.

    Determine number of components of input data.

    WriteVTK.paraview_collection
    WriteVTK.rectilinear_grid
    WriteVTK.save_with_appended_data — Function.

    Write VTK XML file containing appended binary data to disk.

    In this case, the XML file is written manually instead of using the save_file function of LightXML, which doesn't allow to write raw binary data.

    WriteVTK.sizeof_data — Function.

    Total size of data in bytes.

    WriteVTK.vtk_point_data
    WriteVTK.vtk_point_or_cell_data — Function.

    Add either point or cell data to VTK file.

    Here Nc is the number of components of the data (Nc >= 1).

    WriteVTK.vtk_save
    WriteVTK.vtk_write_array — Function.

    Write a Julia array to a VTK image data file (.vti).

    Useful for general visualisation of arrays. The input can be a 2D or 3D array.

    WriteVTK.vtk_xml_write_header
    WriteVTK.write_array — Function.

    Write array of numerical data to stream.
